review_blob: Aroma is not particularly strong. A bit of pine, caramel. The flavor is standard IPA, caramel, pine, and diacetyl. The finish is the same, pine, diacetyl. Medium in body. Ok, obvious brewing defects. s
beer_name: Rumspringa Two in the Bush IPA

review_blob: At the brewpub. The aroma is roasty, bitter chocolate. The flavor is roasty, coffee, bitter chocolate, more bitter than sweet. The appearance is deep black, tan head. The finish is roasty bitter, light piney hops. Medium in body, slightly thick. Decent for the style.
At the brewpub. The aroma is caramel, grass, nuts. The flavor is the same, with light noble hops. Amber color, off white head. Pine in the finish, some noble hops. Decent.
At the brewpub. The aroma is like banana, wet mop. The Flavor is banana, slightly sour, off. The appearance is hazy yellow, white head. The finish is sour, spicy, peppery. Something seems infected.

Not my favorite style. But this is one of the more cleaner and more competently executed beers from these guys. Aroma is slight vegetable, grass, malt. The appearance is straw gold clear, white head. The flavor is malty, grass. The finish is light noble hops. Medium in body. Nice.
Typical amber, caramel, but an odd, off, flavor. Spicy, onion like. Same for the aroma. Medium in body, a tad thin. Amber, slightly red color, off white head. Not impressive.

Odd IIPA. Very, malt forward in aroma and flavor. Strong caramel, tropical fruit, pinapple, and citrus, but not especially hoppy. Bready, in flavor. Medium, slightly thick body. Finish is sweet, lightly citrusy hops. Decent overall, just not quite like an IIPA.

The aroma is nice espresso, dark chocolate. The appearance is deep black, tan head. The flavor is espresso, dark chocolate, roast. The finish is roasty bitter, bittersweet chocolate. Medium in body, a little thinner than expected for the style. Nice overall.
The aroma is fruity, pine. The pour is deep amber, clear, off white head. The flavor is caramel, toffee, pine, slight metal. The finish is pine, fruit. Medium in body. Decent.

Same assertive Belgian yeast, but with a strong citrus flavor. The finish is more citrus, yet the yeast is still imparting the spicyness. The aroma rrelfects the citrus fruits only slightly. Good beer.
Crazy sour, acidic, gym socks, berries on the nose. Flavor follows, a tad more sweet berries. Pink red pour. Thin body. Acidic sour aftertaste. Cool to try, but a one off for me.
beer_name: Off Color Wari: Chicha de mole

review_blob: Tart lemon, yeasty sour. Flavor is tart lemon, yeast, banana, wheat. Finish is spicy, yeasty. Citrus. Medium. Slightly light bodied. OK, standard representative for the style.
Sweet, dry wine aroma. Wood. Flavor is wood sweet, dry wine, paper. Clear deep amber. Medium body. OK.
beer_name: Free Will Bonesaw Barleywine - Pinot Noir

review_blob:
The aroma is bread, grass 
The appearance is clear golden yellow, white head. The flavor is malty, grass, bready. The finish is grassy, spicy, German noble hops medium in body. Uninteresting, but competently brewed.
Tart cherries, mustard, vinegar, dry red wine. Amber, murky appearance. The finish is puckering sour, tart cherries. Nice beverage.

At Barrier. On Nitro. The aroma is dark, bitter chocolate, roast. The appearance is deep black, tan head. The flavor is roasty, ashy, bitter unsweetened chocolate. The finish is roasty, pine. Mediuum in body, maybe a bit thin, perhaps owning to the nitro. OK.

At Barrier Amazing aroma of tropical fruit, citrus. The appearance is clear amber, white head. The flavor is tropical fruit, citrus, earthy. The finish is citrus, flowers. Medium, slightly thick in body. Very nice.
The aroma is honey, vegetable. The appearance is hazy orange, whit head. The flavor is vegetable, honey, caramel. The finish is light pine, noble hops, spicy Medium in body. Decent.

More or less typical brown ale. I had to try this when I saw it on tap, since its unusual for these guys. Standard aroma of nuts, cocoa, grains. flvor follows. Appearance is brown, translucent. Finish is lightly hopped, medium in body. Competent overall, if not outstanding.
The color is dark ruby, off white head. The aroma is fruit, bread, molasses. Thee flavor is fruity, bread, brown sugar. Medium in body. The finish is sweet, light pine. Nice.
beer_name: Two Roads Henrys Farm Double Bock

review_blob: On tap at Good life. Nice aroma of citrus, tropical fruit. Flavor follows. Appearance is hazy yellow, white head. Medium/thick, thick in body. Finish is citrus, grapefruit, pine. Very nice.

The bourbon is overpowering. Barely getting anything else Can hardly tell this is a weisse bock. The nose is bourbon, vanilla, slight belgian yeast. The appearance is a dark amber, cream colored head. The flavor is bourbon, vanilla, dark fruit. The finish is bourbon. The bourbon crushes what might have been an interesting beer.
beer_name: Local Option / Central Waters De Kleine Dood

review_blob: Golden, amber color. Nice sweetness, a bit cloying, some pine and citrus hops. The finish is citrus, pine. Medium/thick in body. Nice overall.

The aroma is earthy, onion. The appearance is deep amber, clear, white head. The flavor is earthy, floral, onion, spicy. Oddly, not very tropical. Medium in body. The finish is citrus, pine. The only place any fruity hops show up. Ok beer. A bit weird.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Beer Camp Tropical IPA

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: The aroma is raisin, fruit, yeast. The appearance is deep, clear amber, off white head. The flavor is sweet, fruity, raisins, plum, yeast, pine  The finish is yeast, chalky, spicy, light pine hops.  Medium in body  Nice overall, a tad weak on the aroma. Maybe because this was overaged.
beer_name: Lost Abbey Gift of the Magi

review_blob: The aroma is tropical fruit, citrus. The appearance is clear amber, white head. The flavor is a bit weak, tropical fruit, pine, light camel backbone. The finish is is citrus, pine. Medium in body. Pretty solid. It is an almost IIPA, which is why he flavor is a tad wanting. Good overall.

The aroma is vanilla, oak, light bourbon, chocolate. Very restrained. The appearance is deep black, tan head. The flavor is chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, licorice. The finish is pine hops, bourbon. Slightly thick mouthfeel. Enjoyable, but overrated, imho.
beer_name: FiftyFifty Imperial Eclipse Stout - Woodford Reserve Barrel

review_blob: Courtesy of a friend at a local bottle shop. Nice aroma of hops, floral, citrus. The pour was deeply hazy amber yellow, white head. Impenetrable body. The flavor is hop forward, citrus, flowers, piney, caramel backbone, chewy, thick bodied. The finish was a panoply of hops, citrus, pine. Certainly reminiscent of the often imitated Heady Topper. Nicely done overall.

From All Island Beverage The aroma is vegetable, caramel, spicy. The appearance is clear deep amber. The flavor is vegetable, caramel, bread, spicy, fruity. The finish is spicy, fruity. Medium, medium thick in body. Nice.

Sort of a pale ale with flavor a added. Not the right base beer for this. The aroma is off the chart spicy, nutmeg, clove, ginger. The appearance is a deep Amber, translucent, cream color head. The flavor is nutmeg, clove, ginger, cinnamon. The finish is spicy. Medium in body. Not bad, not something I would do again.
beer_name: Great South Bay Granny Jannys Gingerbread Cookie Ale

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: The aroma is spicy, caramel, citrus, nutty. The appearance is clear, deep red, white head. The flavor is citrus, nutty, caramel. The finish is sweet, citrus. Medium/thick in body. Nicely done.
beer_name: Port Brewing Shark Attack Double Red Ale

review_blob: The aroma is tangy, lemon, citrus. The appearance is hazy, slightly cloudy amber, tin white head. the flavor is citrus, light vegetable, spicy, lemon. Creamy mouthfeel, medium in body. The finish is lemon peel, citrus. Decent overall.

The aroma is fruit, maple, bread. The appearance is red brown, hazy, thin head. The flavor is sweet, fruity, bread, vanilla maple, lightly boozy. The finish is boozy, sweet, vanilla. Medium/thick, oily mouthfeel. Nice.
beer_name: Otter Creek / Lawsons Finest Liquids Double or Nothing

review_blob: Standard for the series, but still a remarkable beer. Aroma is chocolate, spicy, boozy, berries, chocolate. Dark, black, oily appearance. Awesome deep chocolate, booze soaked cherries, spicy rye after a few seconds, nice. Thick, chewy. Finish is spicy, boozy, sweet, salty. Nicely done.
beer_name: Goose Island Bourbon County Stout - Regal Rye Barrel

review_blob: On tap at All Island Bellmore The aroma is tropical fruit, citrus. The appearance is amber, white head, lightly cloudy. The flavor is sweet, tropical fruit, citrus, pine the finish is citrus, pine. Medium, slightly thick in body. Nicely done DIPA.
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - The Calling IPA

review_blob: The aroma is malty, biscuit. The appearance is hazy amber, white head. The flavor is sweet. Malty, fruit, pine, bread. Light diacetyl, buttery taste snd aroma. The finish is sweet, pine, floral hops. Nice.
beer_name: Evil Twin Molotov Cocktail Single Simcoe Hop Edition

review_blob:
From Bellmoe Beverage. The aroma is roast, dark chocolate, cream. The appearance is deep black, thin tan head. The flavor is chocolate, molasses, pine, roast. The finish is 
Pine, roast. Medium thick to thick in body. Nice.

The aroma is citrus, other dank hops, caramel, bread. The appearance is clear amber, white head. The flavor is bready, caramel, citrus, fruity. The finish is citrus, grapefruit, pine. Medium, slightly thick in body. Decent, enjoyable.

The aroma is dark fruit, raisins, cherries, yeast. The appearance is deep brown, ruby hue, almost black, tan head. The flavor is fruity, dark fruit, raisin, cherry, yeast, cocoa. The finish is fruit, yeast, spicy. Medium in body. Not much different than last year, but really nice.

The aroma is chocolate syrup, orange peel. The appearance is deep black, light tan head. The flavor is chocolate syrup, orange peel. The finish is roasty, citrus, orange rind. Nice, full body. This is essentially Choklat with orange peel. But it works better than you would think. It rescues a beer which is way too sweet and cloying.
beer_name: Southern Tier Blackwater Series: Choklat Oranj

review_blob: Essentially, this is the same as the Weihenstephaner hefe, except with more citrus on the nose, and the flavor and the finish. Pretty decent and refreshing, though. A nice twist on a classic.

The aroma is sharp lemongrass, Belgian yeast, light fruit. The appearance is hazy yellow, fluffy white head. The flavor is lemongrass, yeast, fruity. The finish is spicy, yeasty. Light/medium in body. Good.

The aroma is nuts, caramel, toasted malts, pine. The appearance is slightly hazy red, off/white head. The flavor is toasted malt, caramel, nutty, pine, citrus. The finish is pine, citrus. Medium in body. Nicely done.
beer_name: Founders Backstage Series #13: reDANKulous Imperial Red IPA

review_blob: The aroma is caramel, brown sugar. The appearance is deep red, white head. The flavor is caramel, toasted malt, sweet. The finish is spicy, sweet. Thin in body. Nice for the style.

The aroma is vanilla, oak, chocolate. The apearance is deep black, light tan head. The flavor is chocolate, vanilla, light bourbon. Medium/thick in body. The finish is pine, roast, light booze burn booze wel hidden the barrel aging doesnt overpower Nicely done.

The aroma is Belgian yeast, bready. The appearance is clear gold/amber, white head, bubbles. The flavor is spicy, yeasty, biscuit. The finish is yeasty, spicy, grassy. relatively high carbonation. This beer is not quite sure what it wants to be. Works OK for me though.

At Bellmore Beverage. The aroma is pumpkin pie spices, boozy, bourbon, dark fruit. The appearance is a gorgeous deep amber, actually deep red brown, with a off white head. The flavor is booze, bourbon, vanilla, dark, ripe fruit, cinnamon, nutmeg. The finish is bourbon booze burn, sweet, spices. Medium/thick in body. Actually, pretty awesome.

The aroma is roasted malts, coffee. The appearance is brown/black, thin tan head.. The flavor is coffee up front, roasty, light chocolate, dark fruits, nicer than the aroma implies. The finish is smooth coffee, almost no bitterness, just a tad of roastiness. Medium/thick to thick in body. No bad at all, if not a standout in its field.
beer_name: Central Waters Satin Solitude Imperial Stout

review_blob: The aroma is dank, citrus. The appearance is hazy amber, thin, disappearing head. The flavor is earthy, citrus, caramel. The finish is dry. Citrus, grapefruit. Thin in body. Really feels like a session beer. Ok overall. Pleasant in aroma, boring in taste and palate.
The aroma is peach, mango, pine. The appearance is hazy amber, white head. The flavor is pine, peach, tropical fruit. The finish is pine, lightly sweet. Medium in body, slightly thick. Nicely done.
